ovdesc.p: Record retention and DELIVERY data interfaces for the Stock Reconciliation application.

desc.p: Determines which pair of Swift Messages will get used for Security Stock Reconciliations.
This field contains the type of record that will be generated for the GLOBUS.LOCATION file. This may be either DIVERT or MESSAGE
7 character alphanumeric field. Must be either DIVERT or MESSAGE
This field contains the location (ie. file name) that outgoing statements will be routed to when generated. The F. prefix should be omitted.
15character alphanumeric field name
Must be an entry in the FILE.CONTROL application.
Defines the number of days that reconciliation data will be kept on the live file of SR.HOLDINGS.
Data will remain on the file until the number of days specified here have elapsed, after which it will be moved to history.
The End of Day batch SC.BATCH.RECON will delete the data on a daily basis once the time for data to be held has been exceeded.
If the field is blank then data will remain in the live file and will not be moved to the history file.
Up to 3 numeric plus 1 alpha characters.
The number of days may be suffixed with 'C' for Calendar or 'W' for Working.
The key to the record, must be SYSTEM.
This field contains the name of the record into which outgoing statements will be diverted. If the GLOBUS.TYPE field is set to MESSAGE, this field should be left blank.

Defines the number of days that ad-hoc message data will be kept in the live file of SR.STATEMENT.REQUEST.
Data will remain on the file until the number of days specified here have elapsed, after which it will be moved to history.
The End of Day batch SC.BATCH.RECON will delete the data on a daily basis once the time for data to be held has been exceeded.
If the field is blank then data will remain in the live file and will not be moved to the history file.
Up to 3 numeric plus 1 alpha characters.
The number of days may be suffixed with 'C' for Calendar or 'W' for Working.
This is the the type of Statement requested from the Depository when initiating Security Stock Reconciliation.
The data appearing in this field is controlled by the data entered in the REQUEST.STATEMENT field.
"NOINPUT" field
This field is used in conjunction with the applications ALT.SEC.PARAMETER and SECURITY.MASTER to determine the ISIN code.

When this field is populated the ISIN code used in the statement request message and in decoding the statement of holdings message will be obtained from the field specified in SECURITY.MASTER field ALT.SECURITY.NO, if not specified the ISIN code will be obtained from the field I.S.I.N. in SECURITY.MASTER
Must be a record in ALT.SEC.PARAMETER
